name: Shannon Harwell
text: Dr. Ligon has been so wonderful and the most thorough provider.  She has a very knowledgeable understanding of my health.  I have been a patient of her for while and am very thankful to have her caring for me.

name: Kim Knight
text: I love Dr Ligon!  She truly cares about me and my health. She looks outside the box in helping me with my health concerns. She and her staff are responsive to my calls and emails and constantly looking for ways to improve her practice.

name: Adriana Neyra
text: WONDERFUL DOCTOR!! not only treated my symptoms but went above and beyond! The staff is wonderful from the check in staff to her nurse Jennifer who is AMAZING and has the best touch for shots lol. Now not only do they treat me but both my daughters as well. Truly blessed to finally have found a great doctor.

name: Michelle Mayo
text: Dr. Ligon is an amazing doctor and boss. She treats her patients as humans and not a pay check. She cares for every person that walks through that door. She listens to her patients and she does what they want done. She is open to alternatives other than just pushing medications. Switching to MDVip was the best thing she could do for her patients. She is able to have one on one time with them, take longer during each patients appointment. She gives each patient her personal phone number so that they can contact her directly. She cares for her patients and treats them as family. She is also very knowledgable in her studies and has treated many patients that had seen different doctors for many many years, and is able to find the problem in a short amount of time when other doctors couldn't find the cause of their issues. She is very knowledgable in hormone therapy as well.

name: Penny Bright
text: I am beyond happy with Dr. Ligon and her staff.  I have been using her for over a year now and each time there is hardly any wait at all.  They listen to what I have to say and truly appear to care.  from the front desk to check out. I would highly recommend this office and doctor.

name: thomas dunnavant
text: My mother is in a assisted living home.  This doctor has been generally late, and unresponsive.  Normal response is take her to the emergency room, sit down there for hours on end until finally, she is admitted.  This is a doctor with no heart or compassion.  A fool on a hill.   Now, weeks after post, this doctor took a WEEK to respond for a simple request.  Real piece of work here.  I would take that one star and stick it where the sun dont shine.

name: Cat Masucci
text: Extremely satisfied with the level of care and value for the MDVIP service.  I was initially  hesitant  with joining MDVIP, but I am more than satisfied with the level of care of Dr. Ligon. Usually, I do not complete reviews, but I feel very strongly about her care and concern for her patients.  I would highly recommend her!

name: Jamie Axelson
text: The best Doctor I ever had.

name: Jaiden Dejarnett
text: I Absolutely Love Dr. Ligon. She is the best. Her nurse Jennifer is too. They take care of me. Glad i found them.

name: Kimi Alexander
text: They are amazing and very caring! I love her and Jennifer.

name: Bill Case
text: Very knowledgable and genuinely concerned with your health and fitness.

name: Amber
text: I really liked Dr. Ligon. I switched my whole family over making her our Primary doctor with BCBS of AL almost a year ago. I have a pretty healthy family so one of my daughters and myself have never actually had to see her. One daughter has a monthly prescription we have to see a doctor to get refilled. We filled out ALL of our paperwork at the same time. Now that she is switching to this "MDVIP" program in September, they will not make an appointment for my other daughter to get a sports physical in less than a week because she will be considered a "new patient" unless I pay $1,800 to join the program (that doesn't start until September). This almost $2,000 for the year doesn't even cover everything, still have to maintain my insurance (almost $400 a month) to cover sick visits. Talk about not caring about your patients and being all about the benjamins. Now I will have to switch primary doctors and probably pay a fee to BCBS since it hasn't been a whole year yet.

name: Lareeia Howard
text: Dr. Ligon is a great doctor and her staff is very friendly.

name: Susan “Susan”
text:
Love, Love, Love Dr. Ligon and her Staff!!
Very caring and concerned about me and all my health issues.
Jennifer, her Nurse is awesome!
Jennifer is very friendly and knowledgeable.
I wish I had found Dr. Ligon sooner and made the switch.
You must be patient when going to her office.  She is very busy so you will have a wait but it's worth the wait.
Dr. Ligon and Staff never make you feel rushed or unimportant... NEVER
Love this Dr. And Staff!!

name: Regina Mccullough
text: Love Dr Ligon! And Jennifer is a hoot!  Both are very caring and are going to get to the root of the problems that you may be having. I drive almost 2 hours for my appointments but it is so worth it! Glad to have finally found a doctor that truly cares, understands and  listens without rushing you through trying to get to the next patient. I don't think I've ever had a doctor that  personally called me to check and see how I was doing. I highly recommend Dr Ligon and Jennifer is a bonus!! Lol

name: Pinky 12
text: The reason I'm scoring this is due to horrible time organization. I had been wanting to find a good doctor and seen the good reviews for the Dr. Ligon. Since going I have not only seen her once. I have not seen her since my initial 1st appointment, due to extreme wait times and or changing of my appointment. Yes staff is smiling face and Dr may be good. However to wait over 25 mins for an appt every time is unacceptable. I have work and to show up and always be told you have to wait over 15 mins is not professional. I think I will be finding another Doctor.  I'm very disappointed with the service.

name: L Fletcher
text: Love Dr. Ligon, she is very attentive and listens to what you have to say.

name: Veronica Love
text: Very caring  Doctor....love her to life

name: Amber Lindenmayer
text: I've been seeing Dr. Ligon for around 5 or 6 years, she is great very easy to get into her office, her nurse Jennifer is amazing. She makes sure she answers your questions to the best of her knowledge and makes sure that if your having a problem that she runs all kinds of test to pin point the problem absoutley LOVE Dr. Ligon!

name: Laurie Lawrence
text: Awsome dr and staff her nurse Jennifer is wonderful

name: Beth Pierce
text: Dr. Ligon has been my doctor for over eight years.  She listens well, does not rush to prescribe, but sometimes offers alternatives (physical therapies, holistic approaches) that show she really wants to get to the heart of the problem, not just get you out of the exam room.  I don't know about you, but this is what I want in a doctor.

name: Mark McKinney
text: Horrible customer service.  Appointment at 4:45 turned into waiting till 5:45.  Hours start at 8 they don't open doors till 8:30.  It's been 2 weeks since test results came in and still don't know what they say.  Hope it's not important.

name: Jerry Lynn
text: I'm a civilian pilot flying is my profession Dr. Ligon and her staff always goes above and beyond. Glad I found her as my doctor.

name: Todd Addison
text: Did not correct my issue and was very stubborn about listening to what I was saying about it.  After his first surgery I still had same pain in my left hand.  I explained that I felt it was Golf related. I felt I had a broken hamate bone.. he was adamant about blowing me off.  After being released from him, I went to Andrew’s Orthopedic and they confirmed exactly what I thought.  My “Hook of the Hamate” was fractured. Now I’m having surgery to fix what was my issue. What a complete waste of my time he was!

name: Aaron Southern
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz for carpal tunnel syndrome. His staff was fantastic. They were able to get me an appointment right away. Dr. Bonatz took his time to make sure every question I had was answered. Their surgery coordinator was able to work me into their surgery schedule within the following week. After the surgery, I was back to work within 3 days, typing on a keyboard all day. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. I am currently scheduling my surgery with my other hand. Definitely check them out!

resp.text: Wow, we appreciate the high praise, Aaron! We're thankful you chose us to be a part of your recovery journey, and we'll be sure to pass along your kind words to everyone involved.

name: Jason Hall
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz by my orthopedic surgeon. She had told me that he was one of the best hand surgeons around. I will say that received great care and the surgery went well. Very pleased with the overall experience. He is the best.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Mr. Hall! We're thrilled that you had a great experience with our clinic.

name: Jared Dailey
text: Dr. Bonantz is rude, does not listen, and does not deal with the correct problems.  I went to him with a hand problem and he informed me I am an overweight diabetic,  which I already knew.  He sent his nurse in with papers for bariatric surgery across the hall.  I have a cyst in my hand I need removed.   I'm well aware of my weight problems.   I have to buy my clothes.  No thank you, you rude, self righteous know it all.  He also told me I would die without the covid vaccine,  and he's told multiple other people this.  I would not recommend this "doctor" to anyone. for anytbing

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention, Jared. We at Southlake Orthopaedics hold ourselves to the highest possible standards of patient care, so we are terribly sorry to hear about this experience. Please reach out to me at (205) 985-4111 or email me at mjones@slortho.com so we can better understand the problem and better serve our patients in the future.

name: Kimberli Calma
text: Dr. Bonatz and his staff are amazing! He is brilliant and he has surrounded himself with an amazing knowledgeable and caring team.  Their attentiveness and follow up is amazing and this comes from a patient with an emergency on a Friday that continued over the weekend into the following week.  They did not miss a beat ensuring I have a healthy full functioning hand.  Thank you Thank you!

name: candy j
text: Dr. Bonatz has to be one of the worst doctors I’ve ever seen. My first visit with him was Nov 6 fracture ring finger sprained middle finger. He had me to start Occupational Therapy immediately. My return visit with Dec 8. My range of motion had improved however the strengthening had not even begun. All of my OT were saying the same thing my hand needed further OT because of my job. On Dec 8 2020 Dr. Bonazt entered the room and began talking with the door of the room wide open. I asked if he could close the door while we discussed my injury. His response no because of COVID-19 a violation of my patients rights mind you Dr. Bonazt was not wearing a mask nor gloves so much for concerns. Also, while waiting on him the door was closed the entire time and anyone else that entered closed the door behind them. He ask me what my job title was twice which I’m sure was on my report. He indicated that the fracture was healing pretty good I didn’t need surgery and therefore there was nothing else he could do. I question him because I must be 100% my strength in my hand indicated that I could hold up to13lbs briefly. I asked him for copies of the report he denied me of that also, stating that workman’s comp would have to request it. Forgetting when I visit him the first time he did.  His sarcastic remarks and tone was very belittling. To add insult to injury as he was walking out he says if you break anything else come see me. Unbelievable and Rude he obviously doesn’t care because there’s no repercussions behind his actions.

name: Kaye Byrd
text: Dr. Bonanza and assistants were pleasant, explained procedures, and answered my questions fully.

name: Jane Carson
text: Office staff was very friendly and helpful . Dr Bonatz was on spot and Office was quick to setup the additional testing to verify my issues so that Dr Bonatz could resolve them. I learned about him from a friend w similar probs and she had excellent results. From everything so far,  I’m sure I will have the same excellent results.

name: Marilyn Seier
text: Excellent surgeon and has operated on both wrists and more recently my right hand. He thoroughly explains the diagnosis and the course of action to repair the problem. In case of an emergency like with my hand he saw me right away and planned surgery two days later. My Southlake physical therapist, Cathy, helped me rehab after all 3 surgeries and she is fantastic

name: Bobby Smith
text: Friendly, helpful,great staff, treat you like family.

name: Crystal Watford
text: Dr. Bonatz is professional, personable, and also quick, which I appreciate. He makes sure I understand what he has explained before leaving the room. He's done one surgery on my hand and is about to do another. I have no hesitations.

name: Ruth Black
text: He’s a sadistic man. Don’t go to him!  He hurts you & he allows you to be in excruciating pain after surgery. There are GREAT hand surgeons in Birmingham who have MANNERS and do not enjoy seeing their patients in pain.  One is Dr. Smith. He’s in the same office.

name: Beverly Kirkpatrick
text: Everyone was very friendly & professional. Dr. Bonatz was very thorough & explained everything concerning treatment for my problem. I would definitely recommend to others.

name: Candis Threatt
text: Dr. Bonatz is so straightforward but also very thorough. My son had a broken thumb that most times would require surgery, Dr. Bonatz simply had my son put in a cast and said, "Three weeks!" In exactly three weeks his thumb healed properly and he's back doing what he loves... Playing BASKETBALL! The supporting staff(front desk, nurses, pct, etc) were phenomenal!

name: Staci Rowell
text: Dr Bonatz is brilliant!  He is precise, professional and courteous. Would definitely recommend him to anyone needing hand/wrist treatment.

name: Madelyn Bauman
text: Very pleased with my association with this clinic and Dr. Bonatz. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. Dr. Bonatz is warm, kind and careful, double checking the info received from xrays, etc. Should you be in need of this type medical assistance, I highly recommend this clinic.

name: Efagan53
text: In and out quick, all questions answered in a professional manner

name: William Green
text: The doctor has a sense of humor and a strong personality. He has a plethora of knowledge. I like that. I’d trust him with my children any time!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal at Southlake Orthopaedics is to provide excellent patient care.

name: Jim Cook
text: I don't have the knowledge to evaluate my visit based on the medical expertise of the people I saw, but I can talk about the efficiency of the office personnel, the personal respect from everyone I saw (both for patients and for each other), and the overall positive atmosphere there. Top notch. Dr. Bonatz took a lot of time to examine my inury, and he followed up by taking me out of the examination room to show me details of my x-rays and diagrams of the injury. That was something I liked very much.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide excellent service to all our patients.

name: Laine Poole
text: Absolutely the best possible care for any medical problems related to the hand and wrist.

resp.text: Thank you for the the review.

name: m mills
text:
First I can not say enough good things about the staff, they were extremely nice and compassionate. But Dr Ekkhard Bonatz is not, he has zero ethics. He told me he would preform surgery on my broken wrist but and I quote "it would not work anyway", DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!
I ask if I could see my break on an x-ray and he brought in a plastic arm, he patted my arm and thanked me because he could pay off his daughters college tuition with my injury. He acted like a pediatrician talking to a child. He refused pain treatment and said he would drink if it were him, again DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!

name: Dale Dixon
text: I was very nervous at first, in past others gave me no hope. Dr.Bonatz gave me the hope I have been looking for. Very kind and attentive. I feel 100% positive now. All staff made it a pleasurable visit. Thank you Dr.Bonatz

name: Catherine “Best Friend” Marie
text: I would not send my worst enemy to this man. He lied about the procedure,  he lied about the treatment and was upset and told us that if we were to seek a second opinion he would no longer treat. He gave wrong meds when he had pathology report right in front of him . Not a compassionate person and neither is his assistant. Would NOT recommend.

name: Bo Canning
text:
Dr. Bonatz and staff are the most knowledgeable, caring team in Alabama. Dr. Bonatz took the time to answer all my questions during the process of rebuilding my hand. I never felt rushed by him.
His staff were the same way, taking time to discuss the questions you forgot to ask Dr. Bonatz. They are very knowledgeable and very caring.
His P.T. staff are the  and same way, they know their stuff, and are always encouraging you to do your exercises at home.  If you do what they say, you will improve your hand. (They are the best)
Lastly, the front desk and waiting room, in a word, excellent.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  Our goal is to provide excellent patient care!

name: Chris Davis
text: Hands down one of the best doctors visits ever! Dr. Bonatz put me at ease with his knowledge, straight forward approached with a great dose of humor. His staff was friendly, quick and efficient and I feel like I received the best healthcare. I highly recommend Dr. Bonatz at Southlake Orthopedics

name: Kimberly Snelling
text: Dr Bonatz is least compassionate Dr I have ever had the misfortune to meet! He has no ethics whatsoever. He told my husband he would do surgery on his hand but it probably wouldn't work. He mentioned he needed the money for his daughter s college. He also said he would do the second surgery, he mentioned he wanted to go Spain. He also thanked my husband for fracturing his wrist. If you have hurt yourself and need treatment I wouldn't not recommend Dr. Bonatz. I would not take my dog to him. The staff however were very helpful and compassionate.

resp.text: At Southlake Orthopaedics we certainly sympathize with our patients and the pain they have due to injuries or other conditions.  Very sorry you found your recent visit to be unsatisfactory to the standard you expected.  We are happy to coordinate a second opinion with one of our other Board Certified physicians if you so choose.  Our goal is to improve any conditions we can.

name: DEBRA SMITH
text: Dr. Bonatz and staff gave me excellent care before and after surgery. I couldn't have ask for better treatment.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Juandelisha Perry
text: I am so greatful to have met Dr. Bonatz and the staff of Southland  orthopedic. For over 10+ years of  chronic pain I spent years searching for help and  consulting with my primay physican, rheumatologist,  neurologist, osteoarthritis, pain management, and any other specialist.   Unfortunately, they all gave up on me and past me on to the next specialist. Finally, I was referred to, I was Dr. Bonatz.  The frist cosultation, he knew what was wrong, schedule some tests and did not give up on me until he solved the problem.  For the first time in years, I can sleep at night with out pain, go outside during the winter with out pain. Thank you so much!!!

name: C Miller
text: I am due to have surgery with Dr. Bonatz  in the next couple of weeks. So I cannot speak of that experience yet. I can however speak of his Staff which has been wonderful, and informative, as has Dr. Bonatz. I would have given 5 stars except for the fact both times I have been to see him, once at Grandview, the other at the Southlake office, both times I had to wait 20 to 30 minutes past my appointment time. I realize they get busy, however  my time is important as well   My suggestion would be to find a way to improve upon that.  It’s a shame to have an appointment time of 1:15pm and not leave until 3:00.

name: Kassie Luster
text: We had a really good experience with Dr Bonatz. We were very pleased with the care we recieved. My 10 yr old broke her pinky finger and it went into her growth plate. He was very good with her and making the right decision for her care. She was in a custom splint made for just her size for 3 weeks. We went back and he was so nice. Said she was healing nicely. She really liked him alot and would recommend anyone else with smaller children to see him. Staff was really awesome as well. We had not longer than a five min wait time each time we went.

text: Dr. Miller is very cruel and uncaring. This is the most unprofessionally run doctor’s office I’ve ever been to. They treated me with disrespect and the nurse actually laughed at my concerns. I went in after moving from Soith Alabama in order for me to keep receiving a very vital prescription that I need to function on a daily basis. They e-scribed the meds to the Walmart pharmacy in Jasper. Well, the Walmart pharmacy was going to have to order it and it would take three days. Well, I needed the meds that day because I had started a new job and needed the meds to function properly and hold down my job. So, I called Dr. Miller to ask her to e-scribe it to the CVS. Well, it’s now three days later and Dr. Miller still hasn’t e-scribed the medicine. I’ve never in my life been treated so disrespectfully by a medical staff in my life. Luckily, my doctor’s office in my old town e-scribed the script in for me or else I would have eventually lost my job waiting on Dr. Miller. This clinic is a JOKE. The people who work there are a JOKE.

name: Brandy Reynolds
text: I went here nearly 5 months ago after a bad spat of bronchitis, upper respiratory infection and lung infection. I had a horrible cough during that and developed a hard pressure in the upper center part of my stomach which is pushing on my ribs and heart (possibly vagus nerve) I explained all of this to the doctor that I seen and told him I was having problems breathing since it started, much worse when I sat down. I also explained to this doctor that I had been taking meds for migraines but had ran out and needed a refill. Once this doctor found out I was a smoker, he seemed to not even care at all. He blamed everything on smoking. I had my 12 year old son in the room at the time and this doctor literally drew a graph of how long I was going to live on the bed paper. He terrified my son!!! I knew then I'd never see that man again! Instead of checking to see what the pressure was and instead of refilling a med I had been taking for 12 years he put me on Buspar. The first night I took that Buspar the pressure increased so bad I could hardly move! I'm also now having to take bp meds since all of this. I'm 34 years old, I should not have all of this going on and for it to hit like it did all at once. And instead of this doctor trying to help me he terrified my son! He also prescribed me Naproxen which luckily I didn't take because I went to St. Vincent where they done at egd and found I have chronic gastritis as well as reflux esophagitis so the Naproxen could have caused a stomach bleed... I've seen another doctor here who is better than the first but I am still having the same issues. I'm honestly believing a stuck hiatal hernia or something else has been missed. The new doc put me on zantac which didn't help either. I feel no better, in fact I feel worse than when I did when I went to try and get help here about 5 months ago. As far as the staff, nurses and other docs they are great. The first doc I saw I would not recommend to my worst enemy!

text: Lovely new facility, with a great setting beside the sculpture park greenspace on one side. Waaay better overall than the previous location for Family Medicine clinics on Lafayette Street. Been waiting 25 years to see these. Customer service needs the same upgrade. Also, reserved parking for people with disabilities was unavailable (not enough) on one visit, and had to park on curb at 2nd floor entrance. On another visit, there were open was one open space. So even though there may be the required 1 per 25, if you have a clinic that serves a high ratio of people with medical conditions that require use of reserved parking, then you need to provide more than what is required by law. It is crazy  to move to a new facility, and still not have enough parking. Either need to add more spaces, offer valet parking or post security outside to give people direction and permission to park safely elsewhere.

If you can’t get help for your child, fight with everything you have to get a referral to this man!! He is definitely an answer to our prayers!

name: Jeff Franklin
text:
Absolutely the worst patient processing timing ever.
Took mother due to awful pain in back. 2 1/2 hour wait to see doctor Heck. We got there 15 minutes before the scheduled time to be there. I am sure if we missed it they would want to charge for missing schedule. I am totally fed up with doctors that over schedule and then want to charge you if you are late. Not sure if I would go back if doctor recommended him. “Heck” I am not sure if he will show up!

Inexcusable for that type of waiting, especially when it is a back doctor.

name: Andrea F.
text:
Dr Heck saved my life.  Went to the ER at another hospital before seeing him and they thought I was trying to get drugs since I was complaining about back pain.  Dr heck took me seriously and did surgery even though my MRI wasn’t that bad.  Found out during surgery that I had a rare condition with abnormal nerves in my back. He said he sees this condition about every 2 years. The abnormal nerves were causing the pain - I felt like I was being electrocuted.
He also later performed a back surgery on my mother. Her back is much better now.  We were worried about her surviving the surgery due to her health.  She had a rough recovery - but overall her back is much better.  Highly recommend Heck.

resp.text: Amazing story, Andrea! Thank you so much for sharing it with us, and we're thrilled to hear about you and your family's outcomes. We'll make sure your praise is known to Dr. Heck and the whole team.

text: Dr. Christopher Heck is absolutely the WORST  orthopedic surgeon in Alabama!  Due to his incompetence, a simple disc herniation has resulted in me being disabled. What should have been a three week recovery has now been more than three years with no recovery!  He performed a second surgery and now I need a third.  After two years, and I decided to let God handle him and not sue him, he got very rude with me and told me he did not want to see me anymore and less I want another surgery. After countless procedures and  thousands of dollars in physical therapy, (22 weeks all together) I will now live with his incompetent error!  He definitely lives up to his name! He’s not worth a HECK!!!!

name: Leigh Pearson
text: Dr. Christopher Heck is so amazing!  He has performed a discectomy for my sister (herniated disc with a conjoined nerve root that he found during surgery, that was causing more pain than just a herniated disc would cause).  She is doing fantastic!  He also performed a fusion from L3/L4 to L5/S1 for my mother who suffers from severe spinal stenosis.  She went from a wheelchair to a walker, and the walker is only because she has neuropathy in both feet!  I cannot say enough about how wonderful this man is!  And he’s not only a smart and talented surgeon, but he’s kind and takes the time to listen to his patients (and their caregivers)!

resp.text: I appreciate the feedback you provided!

name: Angela Thornburg
text:
Dr. Heck is "The DOCTOR" to go see. He is personable, doesn't forget what is going on with you. He explains all procedures in detail with words and explanations that you understand.
With having 3 back surgeries before i was referred by Dr. Lawler from Oxford Alabama. My back kept becoming worse and the pain got to the point I couldnt take it anymore after hurting for about 6 years. Dr. Heck told me that he could help me but i had to have a long and extensive back surgery that was about 5 to 6 hours long. I was ready for anything and I left his office that day confident he would help me.
Dr. Heck came out 3 times during the surgery to speak to my husband to let him know how I was doing, and where he was in the surgery. That meant so much to my husband and me that he had that much consideration not to leave my husband wondering what was going on.
I came out of surgery that day PAINFREE, after 6 years of constant hurting.  I was Up walking around the hospital floor on the second day feeling like wonder woman, I went home on the 3rd day. I can also walk straight and stand straight. That was a bonus that I didn't know that could be fixed.
Everyone from the nurse care in recovery, the nurses there on the floor that took the most gentle and sweet care of me. The sweet people that brought your food, the folks that came to your room to get your food order, to the sweet sweet girls that cleaned my room were a joy to be around. GREAT HOSPITAL!!
Both of Dr Heck's office staff are great and attentive.  They Call You Right Back, friendly, and they get you right in to see him.
I can't say enough great things about Dr. Heck and his staff.  Go see him and get your hurting fixed by a Great Doctor!!! All I can say is Thank God for Dr. Heck because I can't say enough of good about him.

For years I have experienced trouble with a dia betic foot break. I thought it would be an afiction I would bear the rest of my life.  Then I found Dr. Krauss and Southlake Orthopeadics. name: kristi gibbons
text: The ONLY reason this rating isn't a 5+ is the wait time. The staff are all wonderful and Dr Green makes you feel as if you are the only patient in the world. He is an excellent diagnostician and a great communicator...he always makes certain that you understand what's going on without "talking down" to you. We have also met with Chris and Hallie on occasion and they are both very thorough, competent, and compassionate. So, even though the wait time seems excessive, Dr Green and his well chosen staff make it worth the wait.

resp.text: Wow - we really appreciate your kind and thoughtful words.  When it comes to our patients' health, we think that a visit simply takes however long it takes.  We abhor the idea of asking our patients to "come back next week" just to address the fourth, fifth, and sixth items on their list of concerns simply because they wouldn't fit into the 15-minute slot that the doctor was willing to provide; ultimately, that delays care and often leads to the patient spending more time overall at the office - not to mention the extra copayment. At the same time, we loathe waiting too, and we are focused on reducing the "however long it takes" part of visits, WITHOUT sacrificing the quality and detail of service - because quality MUST come before efficiency. The healthcare system that most primary care practices must operate in today doesn't promote high-quality care; one reason is that providing detailed care takes more time than it should.  It's time that the systems were designed from scratch.  Stay tuned.

name: Michelle Creacy
text: Out initial visit was excellent! My husband and I both saw Hallie, the PA. She was very thorough and knowledgeable. After 2 years of seeing a DO, who never once checked out heart rate and lungs,  it was a relief when that was one of the first things she checked... finding a slight heart murmur and an extra beat in my heart rhythm, she did an EKG in the office and after consulting with Dr. Green, scheduled me for an Echo. I am thankful and we are looking forward to developing a long term relationship with Green Primary Care.

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to share the details of your experience!  (And Hallie appreciates that you spelled her name correctly!) The model of collaborative practice between PA and MD is intended to work just precisely as you described.  Long-term relationships with our patients are the primary joy of what we do, and we welcome patients who seek the same.  Thanks again for your comments.

resp.text: Mr. Loncaric - We appreciate your kind words.  It's very important to us that our patients receive thoughtful advice, regardless of how long that may require.  At times that doesn't take long, and with  simple things, time is of the essence.  Yet, our patients often come see us for concerns that aren't so simple.  Our philosophy in our system is that speed can accompany quality (as with simple things), and quality can come before speed (which is often necessary for things that aren't so simple), but speed can never come before quality of the hierarchy of priorities.  Thanks again for your feedback!

name: Scott Moss
text:
We are new patients, we had a good experience with the Nurse Practitioner (Chris), we've not met Dr. Green yet. We just had physicals and don't have to see a doctor very often thankfully. I will say their EMR system is just so-so. Even after almost a month, our labs did not post to our account. They did send them in private messages but I feel it would be helpful if your medical records and tests were easily accessible.

In my experience, I generally never have issues with medical professionals, it is the support people that usually cause difficulty (office and billing).

My recommendations, post lab results promptly to the patient account. It would have been nice for our first visit to have been with Dr. Green.

resp.text: Mr. Moss - Thank you for the kind words about Chris - we consider it a privilege to take care of our patients.  We share your feelings about the labs.  Just to clarify, in most cases, as in your case, we review our patient's lab results as quickly as we can, almost always within a couple of days of our receipt of the data.  Then, if the patient requests that we we do so (and not every patient desires that we do), we will share the results on the portal, where they can be seen by the patient directly.  Exactly how the results are displayed on the portal, however, depends upon how the lab sends us the results.  If the lab provides results to us in a structured, computer-friendly format (which we prefer), they will appear in the "lab" section; on the other hand, if we receive them via fax, we will forward those pages to the patient in PDF format, which can be viewed on the portal as well, in the "messages" section.  We agree it would be much better if every lab provided their results in structured format, but not all lab vendors are doing that just yet.  We are working hard with our lab vendors to make that a reality, and have been for some time.  We expect that in the very near future, virtually all of our patients' results, including labs drawn here at the office, will be received in a structured way (and, in turn, passed along to the patient that way).  We would like to make things as easy and intuitive as possible, and we agree that would help.  Also, if you would like to see Dr. Green, just give us a call and we will be happy to move up your follow-up appointment sometime sooner.  Thanks again for giving us a chance to take care of you.

name: Debby Griffith
text: Friendly, efficient staff; clean and comfortable office environment.

resp.text: Thanks for your encouraging words, Ms. Griffith!

name: Debbie Hansen
text: We recently moved her and chose Green Primary Care. We like Dr Green and really don’t want to to go through the hassle of finding a new doctor so soon. But only having come twice now, we both are considering a new office. In each of two visits a piece we have waited for over an hour before even seeing him. My husband left a msg for him and he, nor a nurse never returned the call. What if it had been an emergency?

resp.text: Ms. Hansen, thanks for the kind words about our doctor.  We understand the frustration of waiting for someone.  Suffice it to say that this spring and summer have certainly been trying seasons for us all, in healthcare and in other areas of life, and our continuing efforts to perfect the patient experience haven't yet consistently manifested in shorter wait times for patients.  Some day soon, they will.  We give each of our patients all of the time they need, and we can only hope that you and your husband have felt that.  We strive to get the right care to the right patient at the right time, and for that reason we have two other providers in our practice at present, an NP and a PA.  They are both quite skilled at treating complex patients, but they naturally tend to see patients for visits that are less complex on average than those handled exclusively by the doctor, and so for some patients there are many times that they may offer a more efficient healthcare encounter.  Consider visiting one of them in the future, and we believe you will find it to be a pleasant experience that you may even prefer.  Every patient will be seen by the doctor periodically as well, and the doctor is always available when necessary.  With respect to the question regarding a return call, we wouldn't want to discuss the specifics of a particular patient's situation in a public forum; however, if there were an urgent matter, we would ask that in the regrettable event that you don't hear back from us promptly, that you simply reach out to us again to check on the status of the issue and to reiterate the urgency of the matter; if there were to be a medical emergency, we would recommend that you seek care at a hospital emergency department and call an ambulance if necessary.  We thank you for giving us the opportunity to care for you and your husband, and we hope to see you again soon.

name: Mark Clark
text: I am sure that Doctor Green is very capable and he seems friendly.   But this office has no regard for the patients' time.  You will wait here for very long times, even the first appointment of the day.   They automatically charge double  for physicals that are covered 100% by insurance.

resp.text: Mark, thanks for the feedback.  We believe you bring up an important point that we would like to highlight.  It’s true that patients sometimes have a wait to see their doctor or practitioner, and we take no pleasure in it when a patient is upset.  We would respectfully disagree, though, that this is due to a lack of regard for our patients’ time.  In fact, we see it as quite the opposite.  We take our time with our patients.  Most patients have many questions, each of which deserves respect, and we strive to consider each one thoroughly at the time it is asked, rather than asking the patient to arbitrarily pick just one or two and return for yet another appointment at another time to handle the rest, which would delay care for weeks or months and require another trip to the office (and possibly another copayment).  We document the decisions we make together in a thoroughly detailed manner, often in the presence of the patient, which takes some time but improves the quality of care and communication.  We also care for our own patients in the hospital, which makes care in the hospital more safe, comfortable, and efficient. (This also means that the first patient in the office on a given day is probably not the first patient of the day overall.)  Whenever possible, we address routine screening and wellness concerns at each visit, so the patient does not have to wait until the annual “wellness” or “physical” visit to receive that care; whenever appropriate, depending on the medical situation, we may perform that service on the same day as a visit for specific medical problems, to save the patient some time; the total cost to the patient is the same, and in some cases the total reimbursement to the practice is less, but most importantly the patient doesn’t have to make an extra trip to the office.  We acknowledge that life is full of trade-offs, and some of the ones we choose to make at our practice have occasionally resulted in wait times longer than we would like.  We are continuously working to improve that, and we are absolutely confident that we will as our systems and workflows improve, but the truth is that the vast majority of our patients believe that it has been worth it, and we would agree with them.  We have tremendous respect for our patients, their time, and their concerns, and we are proud to provide medical care in a way that we are confident reflects that respect - even if it’s necessary to wait at times to experience it.  We consider it a privilege to care for you as our patient and hope to see you again soon.

name: David Gaither
text: My wife went to a wellness evaluation with dr. Green. During this visit she told him of problems she was having and he prescribed medicine and told her of some labs he wanted her to take. We called our insurance and verified these labs were ok. Later after the labs we get a bill for $550. Two labs on this bill that were not covered were never discussed with my wife and she did not know she was having them done. I called the dr. Office and his nurse said the dr. Added these labs and she said they have been having problems with insurance companies not covering them. I asked her why the dr. Did not discuss this with my wife first and the only thing she told me was that the cdc recommends them. Well the CDC is not my insurance company. I called my insurance and asked what was the problem. They told me that the dr sent them the wrong codes. That he sent routine codes instead of diagnostic codes. They called him and asked for the diagnostic codes and he refused to give them the codes saying there were no other codes that can be given. Well I think the insurance company would know if there were no other codes or not. Anyway I called the dr. And asked them why would they knowingly have my wife take labs, they did not discuss with her first, knowing our insurance probably would not pay for if it is only routine and not for a diagnostic purpose. I still have no answer and a big bill for something my wife neither needed or was told he was doing.I DONT TRUST THESE PEOPLE, I CANNOT TRUST dR. gREEN TO DO WHAT IS MEDICALLY AND MORALLY BEST FOR ME AND WIFE.

resp.text: Sir, We are sorry that you are so upset. We are generally meticulous about discussing each diagnostic test that we order with each patient, and the reason for doing so. That's important, in part, for this very reason - we can never know with complete certainty what an insurance company may or may not cover. And, of course, our medical decisions are made, first and foremost, with the good of the patient in mind; whether the insurance company decides to cover them, while important, is a secondary consideration. Medical decisions are made between the patient and the doctor, and no one should come in between that sacred bond. There are various different reasons that a test might be felt to be indicated - sometimes to evaluate an active problem, and other times to screen for a potential problem - and the tests and treatments we select are generally chosen according to scientific evidence and/or according to the clinical guidelines that define the standard of medical care in our country. The "codes" are used to communicate the reasons for tests to the insurance company; sometimes there is more than one code that could be used for a given test for a given patient (because there may be several reasons a test is ordered at a certain point in time), and other times there is really only one code that is appropriate. Some tests the insurance company may decide that they will never cover, and others they may cover only for certain reasons (which can change without notice). If they choose not to cover a test, it's usually not so much because the "wrong" code was sent, but rather because they have chosen not to cover that test for the reason it was ordered. If we can ever provide them other reasons, or codes, that weren't submitted at first because the first set of reasons sent seemed to the doctor to be an adequate explanation, then we will send those additional codes. But sometimes, all of the reasons we supply just aren't enough to get the insurance company to cover the test. Sometimes there are other codes that might get them to cover the test, but these aren't really the "right" codes unless they actually apply to the reasons the test was ordered for that patient at that time. We understand you are upset, and we understand why. But we would respectfully suggest that your concerns about lack of coverage are better directed to your medical insurance plan, which may have a different idea of "medical necessity" than your doctor, and we would further respectfully suggest that you consider that your doctor is the one that defines medical necessity, and that while the doctor has nothing to gain from ordering more tests, the insurance company could potentially have something to gain from declining to pay for some tests. We stand behind the reasons we order all of the tests we order, and the reasons are quite thoroughly documented in each patient's medical record, and we refuse to let another entity dictate to us what is appropriate for our patients.  We strive to review all the tests ordered and their reasons, but there is a lot that goes on during medical appointments, particularly ones that are conducted in-depth as ours are, and while we also work to ensure that the patient understands very well the plan of care, it's quite a lot to ask the patient to also remember every last test ordered and the exact reason why. While it would be great if the patient could remember all of that, that's really more the job of the doctor to take care of that in the medical record. If we failed to mention a test and the reason for it, we certainly wish to apologize. We would just ask you to consider the possibility that all of the tests ordered may have been discussed with your wife, and perhaps she was understandably more focused on the problem that was bothering her than on all of the screening tests that were also being ordered as part of a comprehensive visit. We consider it a privilege to care for our patients and will do whatever we can to be of service.

text: Dr Micheal Davis treated me and performed surgery on me. If you are considering using him for your spine, I recommend you find another doctor. Go to UAB or SOS. I was under his care for 22 months. During the time of my care, I told him I was in excruciating pain. I was treated as if I was narcotic searching. I went to 9 doctors trying to get my MRI repeated after Dr Davis refused to repeat the test. Once the MRI was repeated and found results of severe damage to my spine on all levels, I had no choice but to return to Dr Davis because of the “Doctors are God” big boy club of Montgomery. My surgery that was supposed to only be 2 hours long was an 8 hour surgery. My bones were splintered in my lower back. I had told him prior to the surgery that because of a medical issue that he needed to treat me as if I had a bone infection. He did not. Post surgery he lied and said, “ no more MRI’s, the rods placed in your back are real metal not titanium.” *** Real metal rods were pulled from the market in the year 2000. My rods were put in in 2012. Not only that but he wrote my surgical note rather than dictation and the numbers on my rods are not legible. I also had foot drop and had a massive infection post operative. This was not a tiny infection, my temp peaked at 105.1, plus blood loss. There is much more but I have said enough, find another doctor for your own safety.

Yes, you read that right, 4%.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. text: I took my kids for covid tests Aug 2020. The children were covered by medicaid which pays for covid tests. The urgent care submitted the billing incorrectly as Blue Cross. resp.text:
Steve,

We will be happy to resolve this billing problem for you. Please send your claim to billing@childrensurgent.com and a member of our billing team will reach out to you within the next 24-48 hours. Thank you for your patience!

text: They are so patient with our son who has Autism. Also, saving a spot in line and walking right in was awesome

This means that all of our team is trained on how to make visits more comfortable for our patients who might be on the spectrum or have sensory sensitivities. We even offer free accommodations like noise reducing headphones and weighted lap pads. Thank you for choosing and trusting Urgent Care for Children with the care of your son.

name: Patrick Johns
text: Urgent care for children what a joke I have a six week old daughter that I was told by the pediatrician to take care set up an appointment was scheduled for 8:00 a.m. next morning I was asking confirm my appointment after confirming my appointment I was told that they don't see children under 3 months old what the hell does that mean either you're a child care specialist or you're not I wouldn't take my child here if I was you just to waste of time people are very rude and it's all in what they want to do I suggest you just take your child to the emergency room as I was told to do

resp.text:
Patrick,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. For some chief complaints, like a fever in a 6 week old, there is a high possibility that your child will need ER evaluation due to the need for certain tests that can only be done there. Hence, we have to comply with some basic triage of patients depending on their age and reason for the visit. This is in the best interest of the patient and the family. We are happy to have a team member reach out to explain further over a phone call with you if needed. We hope your daughter is feeling much better!
